;;美国众议员拉希达·特莱布 (D-MI) 与几位众议院民主党同僚一起就特朗普时代针对一些人的旅行禁令六周年发表讲话穆斯林占多数的国家，2023 年 1 月 26 日在美国华盛顿美国国会大厦。路透社/乔纳森·恩斯特/档案照片;
;

;美国众议院周二投票谴责民主党众议员拉希达·特莱布 (Rashida Tlaib)、国会议员唯一的巴勒斯坦裔美国议员，因为她就以色列与加沙的哈马斯战争发表的评论。

;

;二十二名民主党人与众议院中的大多数共和党人一起谴责特莱布涉嫌在哈马斯十月会议上“宣扬虚假叙述” 7 以色列发生枪击事件并“呼吁毁灭以色列国”。

;

;该动议由共和党众议员理查德·麦考密克发起。共和党控制的众议院最终以234票对188票赞成谴责。四名共和党人对该动议投了反对票，三名民主党人和一名共和党人投了弃权票。

;

;特莱布多次谴责哈马斯的袭击事件，该袭击造成约 1,400 人死亡，同时还批评美国对以色列的支持，因为该国军方以轰炸进行报复。该措施特别引用了特莱布在社交媒体上发布的一段视频，其中包含“从河流到海洋”这一短语，这是许多犹太人观看的亲巴勒斯坦的战斗口号周五，她发布了一段视频，指责总统乔·拜登支持“对巴勒斯坦人民的种族灭绝”，这也激怒了许多民主党同僚。以色列强烈否认种族灭绝指控。

;

;特莱布周二在众议院发表讲话时驳斥了反犹太主义指控。

;

;“我是国会中唯一的巴勒斯坦裔美国人，我的观点比以往任何时候都更需要，”特莱布说。

;

;“我的批评一直是以色列政府和（总理本杰明）内塔尼亚胡的行为......批评以色列政府是反犹太主义的想法树立了一个非常危险的先例，”特莱布说。

;

;“巴勒斯坦人民不是可以被抛弃的，”特莱布补充道，她情绪激动，停顿了很长时间。她的祖母住在被占领的约旦河西岸的一个村庄里，该地区是以色列在 1967 年战争中占领的领土。

;

;众议院二号民主党众议员皮特·阿吉拉尔 (Pete Aguilar) 周二告诉记者，虽然他“强烈不同意” ” 特莱布对拜登的言论表明，他认为谴责动议没有成效。

;

;象征性的谴责没有具体的惩罚。尽管这以前是针对议员的罕见措施，但近年来变得越来越普遍。

;

;民主党;2021 年谴责;共和党众议员保罗·戈萨尔 (Paul Gosar) 发布了一段动画视频，视频中描绘了他的角色谋杀民主党代表亚历山大·奥卡西奥-科尔特斯 (Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez) 和共和党人;谴责;民主党人亚当·希夫 (Adam Schiff) 调查前总统唐纳德·特朗普 (Donald Trump) 的工作当他掌权时。

;七国集团外长将于周三就以色列-哈马斯战争发表联合声明，预计将呼吁暂时停止战斗，以允许人道主义援助进入被围困的加沙地带。

;

;这只是自巴勒斯坦激进组织哈马斯的枪手引发与加沙地带的冲突以来，富裕国家集团就这场危机发表的第二份联合声明。 10 月 7 日以色列南部遭到袭击。

;

;该公报将于在东京举行的为期两天的会议即将结束时发表，也可能重申七国集团在乌克兰与俄罗斯的战争中仍然支持乌克兰尽管中东冲突不断升级，但我们的信心并未减弱。

;

;“我们希望能够在七国集团外长声明中就中东局势提出统一的立场，据我们了解，该声明目前正在制定中”日本内阁官房长官松野博和表示。

;

;冲突中的人道主义暂停问题是在英国、加拿大、法国、德国、意大利、日本、美国等国部长出席的工作晚宴上提出的。东道国日本在一份声明中表示，周二，各国和欧盟将在一份声明中表示。

;

;多家日本媒体报道称，预计周三的公报将呼吁暂停战斗，暂时中断战斗，以便向被围困的飞地提供援助据报道。

;

;以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡表示，以色列将考虑“战术上的小停顿”，但与亲密盟友美国和其他西方国家一道，拒绝了停火的呼吁，称这将使哈马斯能够重组。

;

;七国集团;似乎陷入困境; 就以色列在加沙的战争采取坚定、统一的方针达成一致，这引发了对其作为解决重大危机力量的相关性的质疑。

;

;七国集团唯一的另一项声明是在 10 月的财长会议之后发表的12、总计几句简短的句子。其他集团成员也发表了联合声明。

;

;G7在联合国的分歧也很明显，法国在10月26日投票赞成一项呼吁在冲突中实现人道主义休战的决议，美国则反对日本在声明中表示，该组织和该组织的其他成员投了弃权票。

;

;日本在声明中表示，周二部长们还讨论了加沙冲突平息后会发生什么以及如何重振中东和平努力。

;<如果哈马斯激进组织因 ;以色列轰炸;巴勒斯坦飞地。

;

;以色列对其加沙的长期计划一直含糊其辞。内塔尼亚胡本周在有关该主题的一些首次直接评论中表示，以色列将寻求“无限期”地承担加沙的安全责任。

;

;但以色列外交部长埃利·科恩告诉《华尔街日报》以色列希望该领土处于国际联盟之下，包括美国、欧盟和穆斯林占多数的国家，或由加沙政治领导人管理。

;

;华盛顿、联合国、中东和中东地区的外交官Beyond 也开始;权衡选项;。

;据路透社报道，讨论内容包括向冲突后的加沙部署一支多国部队、建立一个由巴勒斯坦领导的临时政府（将哈马斯政客排除在外）、邻国阿拉伯国家的权宜之计的安全和治理作用以及联合国对该领土的临时监督。月。

;;周二，堕胎问题将再次出现在投票中，俄亥俄州居民将投票决定是否保障堕胎权，弗吉尼亚州选民将决定是否赋予共和党对堕胎程序施加新限制的权力。亚历克斯·科恩还有更多。;
;

;民主党人和堕胎权倡导者周二取得了一系列选举胜利，包括在保守的俄亥俄州和肯塔基州，这是一个早期信号，表明生育权仍然是民主党未来的一个潜在问题2024 年总统竞选的重点。

;

;爱迪生研究公司预计，在俄亥俄州，该州在 2020 年总统选举中以 8 个百分点的投票支持共和党人唐纳德·特朗普，选民批准了一项保障堕胎权的宪法修正案。

;

;自美国最高法院去年决定推翻 1972 年《罗伊法案》以来，这一结果延续了堕胎权利倡导者的不败纪录。 v 韦德裁决并取消全国范围内终止妊娠的权利。

;

;在弗吉尼亚州，民主党人似乎准备在州参议院中占据微弱多数，这将使他们能够继续阻止共和党州长格伦·杨金 (Glenn Youngkin) 推行堕胎计划。禁止受孕后 15 周后的大多数堕胎。

;

;民主党立法竞选委员会在一份声明中表示，该党已控制参议院，而众议院仍势均力敌。

;

;并且爱迪生预计，肯塔基州民主党州长安迪·贝希尔 (Andy Beshear) 赢得了第二个四年任期，这与该州在 2020 年以超过 25 个百分点的投票支持率的保守倾向相反。

;

;这些竞争是在 < a href="/world/us/us-election-day-guide-governor-races-abortion-rights-more-2023-11-02/">;全美各地;提供了有关选民所在地的关键线索距离爱荷华州总统提名竞赛拉开帷幕还有不到 10 周时间 ;2024 年总统选举认真地进行竞选活动;。

;

;结果可能有助于缓解一些全国民主党人对乔·拜登总统的;不受选民欢迎;。

;

;拜登在一份声明中赞扬了俄亥俄州的结果，他说：“今晚，美国人再次投票保护他们的基本自由 - 民主获胜。”

;

;贝希尔击败了肯塔基州总检察长丹尼尔·卡梅伦，后者将成为该州第一位黑人首席执行官。

;

;尽管贝希尔有党派背景，得益于他在应对冠状病毒大流行和自然灾害期间的领导能力，他一直保持着较高的支持率。他还以保护堕胎权为主题，尽管他无力推翻该州近乎全面的禁令。

;

;在胜利演讲中，贝希尔称他的胜利是“明确的声明，即愤怒政治应该就此结束”现在。”

;

;俄亥俄州是;最新的堕胎战场;，距最高法院判决已近一年半。

;

;去年，堕胎权利倡导团体通过对堕胎相关的公投取得了一系列胜利选票，包括在保守派州。

;

;他们在这一策略上加倍努力。俄亥俄州的结果将推动已经在进行的努力，以在 2024 年向包括摇摆州亚利桑那州和佛罗里达州在内的几个州的选民提出类似的投票措施。

;

;反堕胎势力反对俄亥俄州修正案过于极端，而反堕胎势力则反对俄亥俄州修正案过于极端，而堕胎权利组织警告说，拒绝该法案将为严格的禁令生效铺平道路。

;

;周二的投票使得共和党控制的立法机构此前批准的六周限制变得毫无意义。该法律已被搁置，等待法律挑战。

;

;在弗吉尼亚州，参议院的所有 40 个席位和众议院的 100 个席位均已进行投票。

;

;;民主党人试图;将堕胎列为首要问题。扬金将他提议的 15 周限制描述为一种温和的妥协，这一策略可以作为共和党明年的蓝图。

;

;共和党未能赢得立法多数是对扬金的谴责，他的政治行动委员会在竞选活动中投入了数百万美元。一些对特朗普持谨慎态度的共和党人将扬金视为可能较晚参加 2024 年总统竞选的人选，尽管州长表示他没有竞选白宫的计划。

;

;拜登上周加大了对竞选的影响力，为 16 名民主党人竞选州众议院议员和 7 名民主党人竞选参议院议员表示支持，同时向支持者发出筹款请求。

;

;周二其他地方，初步结果显示共和党密西西比州州长泰特·里夫斯 (Tate Reeves) 领先他的支持者民主党挑战者布兰登·普雷斯利 (Brandon Presley) 曾任市长，也是歌手埃尔维斯·普雷斯利 (Elvis Presley) 的远房表弟。

;

;普雷斯利 (Presley) 筹集的资金比里夫斯 (Reeves) 多，但在特朗普支持率超过拜登 (Biden) 超过 16% 的州，他面临着艰难的处境。 2020 年的分数。

;

;据爱迪生称，周二晚间的竞选势均力敌，难以分出胜负，但里夫斯领先超过 14 个百分点，预计选票已计入约 60%。

;

;肯塔基州的里夫斯和卡梅伦都得到了特朗普的支持，特朗普是该党 2024 年白宫提名的领跑者，尽管存在一系列法律纠纷。

;;Abortion will once again be on the ballot on Tuesday, as Ohio residents vote on whether to guarantee abortion rights and Virginia voters decide whether to give Republicans the power to impose new limits on the procedure. Alex Cohen has more.;
;

;Ohio voters on Tuesday approved a constitutional amendment guaranteeing abortion rights, Edison Research projected, extending an unbroken winning streak for abortion access advocates since the US Supreme Court's decision last year to eliminate a nationwide right to end pregnancies.

;

;The result in Ohio, a conservative-leaning state that supported Republican Donald Trump by 8 percentage points in the 2020 presidential election, is yet another sign that abortion remains a potent issue for Democrats ahead of the 2024 campaign for the White House.

;

;Meanwhile, Democratic Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear won a second four-year term on Tuesday, Edison Research projected, defying the conservative lean of a state that voted for Republican Donald Trump by more than 25 percentage points in 2020.

;

;Beshear, one of only a handful of Democratic governors in Republican states, defeated state Attorney General Daniel Cameron, who would have been the state's first Black chief executive.

;

;The Ohio and Kentucky contests were among ;several across the US; on Tuesday offering critical clues about where the electorate stands ahead of the ;2024 presidential election;. The votes came less than 10 weeks before the Iowa presidential nominating contest kicks off the 2024 White House campaign in earnest.

;

;In addition to Ohio, abortion also took center stage in Virginia, where Republicans have vowed to pursue new restrictions if they win a majority in the state legislature on Tuesday.

;

;Elsewhere, Republican Mississippi Governor Tate Reeves was seeking another four-year term. His Democratic challenger, Brandon Presley, a former mayor and the second cousin of singer Elvis Presley, raised more funds than Reeves, but faces an uphill climb in a state that voted for Trump over Democratic President Joe Biden by more than 16 percentage points in 2020.

;

;Both Reeves and Cameron were endorsed by Trump, the frontrunner for his party's 2024 White House nomination despite a litany of legal entanglements.

;

;Despite his party affiliation, Beshear has maintained high approval ratings at home, buoyed by his leadership through the coronavirus pandemic and natural disasters.

;

;Ohio was the ;latest abortion battleground;, nearly a year and a half after the Supreme Court decision.

;

;Last year, abortion rights advocacy groups scored a series of victories by placing abortion-related referendums on the ballot, including in conservative states.

;

;They have doubled down on that strategy. In addition to Tuesday's amendment in Ohio that will enshrine abortion rights in the state constitution, similar ballot measures are advancing in several states for 2024, including swing states Arizona and Florida.

;

;Anti-abortion forces campaigned against the Ohio amendment as too extreme, while abortion rights groups warned that rejecting it would pave the way for a stringent ban to take effect.

;

;Tuesday's outcome renders moot a six-week limit that the Republican-controlled legislature had previously approved. That law had been on hold pending a legal challenge.

;

;In Virginia, all 40 seats in the Senate and 100 seats in the House of Delegates were on the ballot. Democrats hold a slim majority in the Senate, while Republicans have a narrow edge in the House.

;

;;Democrats sought; to make abortion the top issue.共和党州长 Glenn Youngkin 表示，如果共和党控制立法机构，他将推行 15 周堕胎限制。 He has portrayed that proposal as a moderate compromise, a tactic that could serve as a blueprint for Republicans next year.

;

;Republicans focused on public safety, running advertisements claiming that Democrats would cut police funding and go easy on criminals. Some 40% of respondents in ;a September Reuters/Ipsos poll; said Republicans have the best approach to addressing crime, compared to 32% who picked Democrats on the issue.

;

;A Republican sweep would boost Youngkin's rising national profile; his political action committee ;invested millions of dollars; in the legislative races. Some Republicans wary of Trump have floated Youngkin as a potential late entry to the 2024 presidential race, though the governor has said he has no plans for a White House run.

;

;Biden added his weight to the race last week, issuing endorsements for 16 Democrats running in competitive races for the state House and seven in the Senate, while sending out a fundraising plea to supporters.

;Last year, abortion rights advocacy groups scored a series of victories by placing abortion-related referendums on the ballot, including in conservative states.

;

;Anti-abortion forces campaigned against the Ohio amendment as too extreme, while abortion rights groups warned that rejecting it would pave the way for a stringent ban to take effect.

;

;Ohio's Republican-controlled legislature previously approved a six-week limit, but the law is on hold pending the outcome of a legal challenge before the conservative state Supreme Court.

;

;In Virginia, all 40 seats in the Senate and 100 seats in the House of Delegates were on the ballot. Democrats hold a slim majority in the Senate, while Republicans have a narrow edge in the House.

;US Secretary of State Antony Blinken is due to arrive in Seoul on Wednesday for talks with his South Korean counterpart, as the allies step up cooperation in the face of growing concerns over North Korea's closer military ties with Russia.

;

;The two-day visit, the first by a US secretary of state in two and a half years, is part of Blinken's broader Asia trip that has included meetings with G7 counterparts and bilateral talks with Japanese officials in Tokyo, as well as a later stop in India amid the Israel-Hamas conflict.

;

;The Seoul visit comes as the United States and South Korea, along with Japan, have ;condemned; what they say is the supply of arms and military equipment by North Korea to Russia.

;

;Washington and Seoul see the closer military ties between the North and Russia, which is thought to be suffering depleting stocks of munitions in its war with Ukraine, as an effort by Pyongyang to secure strategic military capabilities in return.

;

;North Korea is preparing to launch a spy satellite after having failed twice this year to put one in orbit.

;

;South Korea's spy agency said last week North Korea was in the ;final stages; of preparations for the launch after apparently receiving technical assistance from Russia.

;

;Pyongyang and Moscow have denied claims of arms deals while their leaders pledged closer military cooperation when they met in September in Russia's far east.

;

;South Korea's military said on Monday it was on alert over possible North Korea provocations after Pyongyang designated Nov. 18 as "missile industry day" to commemorate the country's launch of an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) last year.

;

;North Korea in November in 2022 tested the Hwasong-17 ICBM, a weapon potentially able to deliver a nuclear warhead to anywhere in the United States.

;

;With aid from the United States, South Korea also plans to launch its first spy satellite on Nov. 30 on a SpaceX Falcon-9 rocket from the US military's Vandenberg base.

;

;A US official has said the United States remained focused on the Indo-Pacific despite other global challenges and Blinken's trip demonstrated such "enduring" commitment.

;

;US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin is also due to visit South Korea this week on a trip that will include Indonesia and India.

;

;In Washington, US and South Korean officials held talks on North Korea's illicit cyber activities that they say fund its unlawful weapons programs, South Korea's foreign ministry said.

;

;Sanctions monitors have accused the reclusive state of using cyberattacks to gather funds for its nuclear and missile programs, and a United Nations report said the North stepped up its cryptocurrency thefts, using sophisticated techniques to steal more in 2022 than any other year.
